intro: Lecointea guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan lecointea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentapetalous flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
